title: Dashboard UI text, header accent color, and chart legend labeling updates

requirements.summary: Replace the dashboard footer credit pill/link with plain text credit.
acceptanceCriteria: In TemperatureDashboardPage, the footer no longer displays the words “Built with love using” or “caffeine.ai”.
The footer displays exactly: “Built by Hannes @Petersime”.
The footer remains visually consistent with the existing footer layout (centered, small text), and does not introduce new user-facing text beyond the requested string.

file_operations.description: Update the footer credit area to remove the styled pill and external link, and render the plain text “Built by Hannes @Petersime” while preserving the existing centered small-text footer layout.

requirements.summary: Make the dashboard header/title bar incorporate accent color #65714B more prominently without breaking layout/readability.
acceptanceCriteria: The header/title bar area at the top of TemperatureDashboardPage clearly incorporates #65714B (via border, background accent strip, or key header elements).
Header text remains readable (sufficient contrast) and the logo/title alignment does not break.

file_operations.description: Adjust header/title bar styling to prominently incorporate the accent color #65714B (e.g., accent border/strip/background treatment) while keeping existing spacing, alignment, and readable text contrast.

requirements.summary: Update the header subtitle copy under the main dashboard title.
acceptanceCriteria: The subtitle in TemperatureDashboardPage displays exactly “Updated every 10 min”.
No other header titles (including the browser tab title) are changed.

file_operations.description: Replace the header subtitle text under “Conceptmachine Live Data” with exactly “Updated every 10 min”, without changing any other titles.

requirements.summary: Clarify in the chart legend that the “Temperature CSV (°F)” series is dashed.

file_operations.description: Update the Recharts Legend label/formatter so the CSV series legend text explicitly indicates a dashed style (e.g., “Temperature CSV (°F) (dashed)”) while keeping the filtered series label meaning intact and preserving the dashed stroke rendering for the CSV line.
